# dataframe-lib-comparison
Example code comparing python dataframe libraries (pandas vs polars vs ...) from the perspective of data science and ml eng

pandas 1.5.3

```python 
>>> python testing_polars_vs_pandas.py 

run_polars_df time: 0.14373421669006348
shape: (5, 6)
┌─────┬────────┬─────┬────────┬──────┬───────────────┐
│ A   ┆ fruits ┆ B   ┆ cars   ┆ NAME ┆ multiply_by_2 │
│ --- ┆ ---    ┆ --- ┆ ---    ┆ ---  ┆ ---           │
│ i64 ┆ str    ┆ i64 ┆ str    ┆ i32  ┆ i64           │
╞═════╪════════╪═════╪════════╪══════╪═══════════════╡
│ 1   ┆ banana ┆ 5   ┆ beetle ┆ 99   ┆ 10            │
│ 2   ┆ banana ┆ 4   ┆ audi   ┆ 99   ┆ 8             │
│ 3   ┆ apple  ┆ 3   ┆ beetle ┆ 99   ┆ 6             │
│ 4   ┆ apple  ┆ 2   ┆ beetle ┆ 99   ┆ 4             │
│ 5   ┆ banana ┆ 1   ┆ beetle ┆ 99   ┆ 2             │
└─────┴────────┴─────┴────────┴──────┴───────────────┘

run_pandas_df time: 0.7659854888916016
   A  fruits  B    cars  NAME  multiply_by_2
0  1  banana  5  beetle    99             10
1  2  banana  4    audi    99              8
2  3   apple  3  beetle    99              6
3  4   apple  2  beetle    99              4
4  5  banana  1  beetle    99              2

```



Pandas 2.0 is out
